title: Regional Command Southwest
text:
Regional Command Southwest, abbreviated RC(SW), was an international military <a href="formation%20%28military%29">formation</a>, of roughly <a href="division%20%28military%29">division</a> size, which was one of the components of the <a href="International%20Security%20Assistance%20Force">International Security Assistance Force</a> in <a href="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a>. It was stood up on 3 July 2010 largely from an area previously in <a href="Train%20Advise%20Assist%20Command%20-%20South">Regional Command South</a>. It was headquartered at <a href="Camp%20Leatherneck">Camp Leatherneck</a> with an area of responsibility of largely <a href="Helmand%20Province">Helmand</a> and <a href="Nimruz%20Province">Nimruz</a> provinces. The <a href="United%20States%20Marine%20Corps">United States Marine Corps</a> provides the majority of the force headquarters. It consisted of <a href="Task%20Force%20Helmand">Task Force Helmand</a> of the <a href="British%20Armed%20Forces">British Armed Forces</a> (including Denmark and Estonia) and <a href="Task%20Force%20Leatherneck">Task Force Leatherneck</a> of the United States Marine Corps. <a href="Provincial%20Reconstruction%20Team%20Helmand">Provincial Reconstruction Team Helmand</a> was also located in Regional Command Southwest.
The command was stood down during 2014.
